Key:
(That day, Origami and I went to see a movie
that was playing in town.)

(I realized there was a definite change after
watching the movie.)

I had never heard of that movie before,
but I actually enjoyed it.

Agreed. I liked the part where everyone started
dancing by the pool after the main character
was asked out.

R-Really? I thought the whole revenge sub-plot
was the best. My hands got all sweaty.

This movie was a hit. Shido, do we have any
plans after this?
Hm. We can go to a café... Ah...
AHCHOOO!

(I let out a mighty sneeze. Even while I was
sitting in the theater, I felt a little chilly.)
Shido, are you okay?
I-I'm fine. Let's go, Origami.
(I didn't want to waste our time together.)

Shido, are you a fan of action films? You mentioned
that your hands were sweaty during the climax.

(Urgh... I'm getting the chills for sure. My nose
is starting to run, and my head's spinning.)
...Shido, are you listening?
Hm? Oh, sorry. What'd you say?
Shido, I think you're getting sick.
N-No, I'm fine.

You seem hotter than usual, and your heart
rate is rising too quickly.
Can you tell just by looking?

Based on my observation, you are in the early
stages of a cold.

I-I may be a little sick, but it's okay. It'll
wear off in no time.
Anyways, where should we go tomorrow?

(I wanted nothing more than to be with Origami,
so I tried my best to ignore the symptoms.)
ACHOO! *whimper*...
Shido, I think you are sick.
Y-Yeah, you're probably right...
You should go home and rest at once.
Right. We have a date tomorrow, too.

(We happened to schedule consecutive dates.
After all, I wanted to see Origami every day.)
You do not have to force yourself.
It's fine. I can sleep it off.

Are you sure you are all right? Shido, you have
a tendency of overdoing it.
I promise I'm fine. See you tomorrow, okay?

(At the time, I didn't think I was pushing myself
too hard. I thought sleeping it off would help.)
Okay, got it.
Later, Origami.
Good-bye. See you tomorrow.
(But that proved to be a costly mistake.)
Ugh...
(The next morning...)
M-My fever...

Oh, no. Not only am I feeling no better, but I
feel even worse.

I can't go on a date in this condition. My head
is splitting, and I'm so dizzy I can't get out of
bed.
Rgh... *cough*!

(I have no choice but to cancel the date.
I feel terrible, but I need to call Origami
and apologize.)

(I crawled out of bed and sluggishly grabbed
my phone. My hand trembled as I selected
Origami in my contacts.)
Hello.

(She picked up immediately, almost as if she
were waiting by the phone, expecting me.)
O-Origami...
What's the matter, Shido?

Sorry. I have a fever, so I'm going to have
to cancel today's date. I'm so sorry...
...Understood.
Sorry, Origami. I know we made plans.
Do not worry. Just rest.
Origami, are you somewhere outdoors?
I am at our meeting place.

What? But it's still morning. Did you leave
at dawn...?
It is not a problem. I woke early and was bored.\nI am heading over to your house at once.
My house...?
I am going to take care of you.

That's sweet of you, but you don't have to do
that.
There is no problem. Caring after a boyfriend\nis the sworn duty of any worthwhile girlfriend.
H-Hey, Origami...
(Origami is coming over...)

(I appreciate the sentiment since I feel lonely
when I'm sick, but...)

If Origami's coming over, I need to clean my
room.

(U-Ugh... I can't. If I try standing, I feel
dizzy.)

(I guess I have no choice but to sleep and
wait for her.)

(I couldn't move, so I lay in bed, drifting
in and out of sleep.)
*groan*...
(In my daze, I heard a knock on my door.)
Shido, may I come inside?
Origami...?

(I sat up, all of a sudden feeling my headache
and dizziness evaporate.)
Shido, are you okay?
Sorry. My room's a mess, Origami.

You are sick. You cannot help it. Do not worry.
For now, lie down.
Thanks... I'll do that.

(My fever was high, and my joints were sore,
so I went back to bed.)
Your temperature is getting higher, no?

(Origami put down the plastic bag in her hand,
and took a seat on my bed. She placed her hand
on my forehead.)
You're really hot...

Yeah. I was hoping to sleep it off, but it won't
go down.

I bought you medicine. I want you to take it
later.
Okay. Thanks.
Anyways, Shido...
What is it...?

I think I know a way that could lower your
temperature.

I have a bad feeling about it already, but go
ahead.

They say that transferring your cold to someone
else will alleviate your symptoms. So if you give
it to me, you will feel better.
To be specific, through your mouth.

Sorry, Origami. I'm so sick that I can't even
react to your joke.
I'm serious.

It'd be pointless for you to get sick, Origami.
I'm rejecting your idea.

If the illness comes from you, it is practically
a gift.
Then we wouldn't be able to go on our date.
But then you would have to care for me.
Just... forget about it.

(But I can sense the gears turning in Origami's head.
I'm covering myself with a blanket now.)
You really don't want to give it to me?
I'm fine. Feeling better already.

(She's inspecting my face. Maybe I can try
to distract her somehow...)
I'm hungry.
My room is dirty.
I'm forgetting something...

I haven't eaten since this morning. Would you
mind finding me something to eat in the kitchen?
Can't take medicine with an empty tummy.
Then, I will prepare you something.
Y-You will?
I can prepare you some porridge. Do not worry.

Er. Just please try not to slip anything in
there.
I shall not. Hang on.
C-Can I trust you?
Shido, it is done.

(Origami brought me a tray with a bowl
and a glass.)
Porridge and water for your medicine.
Oh. Thank you.

(I sat up so she could place the tray on my
lap, and I checked the bowl of porridge.)
Looks normal enough to me.
What are you afraid of?
Nothing. Guess I was overthinking it.
Now, go on. Eat.
Okay, will do.

It was made fresh, so it is still hot.
Be careful.

(I took the spoon and ate for the first time
all day.)

I-It is... hot. Normally I don't mind, but it
stings my sore throat.
Shido, I have a good idea.

Agh... No, you don't have to feed me mouth to
mouth.
Why so quiet?
(Looks like I called it.)
It's fine. There is another way.
There is?
I'll blow on it.
Huh?
Give me the spoon, Shido.

(She snatched my spoon and scooped up a bit
of porridge, bringing it close to her mouth and
puckering her lips.)
*blow, blow*...
Gotcha.

(I think I misinterpreted her initially. Must
be the fever working.)
Okay. Open your mouth.
(She fed the cooled porridge into my mouth.)
You're going to feed me?
It is more efficient that way.
I-I mean, sure...

(I was feeling shy about the whole ordeal, but
at least this way, Origami wouldn't get sick.)
A-Aaaah... *gulp*.
How is it? Still hot?

(When cooled by Origami, the porridge was
the perfect temperature to swallow in one
gulp.)
No, this is fine.
Then, let's continue. *blow*.

(She cooled it once more, and carefully
directed the spoon into my mouth.)

(While at first it was slightly embarrassing,
it went on for a while longer.)

Oh, I had hoped to clean my room before
you got here, but I didn't have enough time.
I can clean it for you.

Oh, really? Thanks... I feel like I'm making
a maid out of you.
Do not worry. You are sick, so get your rest.

(Origami stood up, and began picking up
around my room.)

Shido, are these clothes here your dirty
laundry?

No, those are washed. I was too lazy to
fold them yesterday.
Oh, then I will fold them.

(Origami sat on the floor and began sorting
and folding my laundry on her lap.)
(She looked so domestic and adorable.)
Origami, it almost seems like we're newlyweds.

Of course. I am your future spouse. There
is no one else but me.

...So, is my future wife rubbing my folded
laundry on her body?
I'm putting my scent onto it.
What...?
(Origami, as usual, made the task her own.)
Okay then.

Wait, did you just sneak one of my shirts
into your bag? Make sure everything makes
it into my closet.
Well done, Shido. You have an eagle's eye.
(Man... That's Origami for you.)

Come to think of it, I've got homework to
do. What should I do?
Homework?
Yeah, I just forgot to do it...
Then, I will do it for you.
But...

If you wait for your fever to die down, there
is no telling when it will get done. Do not
prolong the task, or else I cannot see you later.
Well, I think I follow you, but...

But I will do a preliminary draft of your
assignment. That way, you will have something
to turn in.
...Got it.

(Origami took a seat at my desk and began
my homework.)
Shido.
What's the matter, Origami?

I may have to adjust my handwriting. Otherwise,
you will most certainly be caught.

I think... if you can write like a guy, you'll be
fine.
Got it. I will try.
Awesome.
But, Shido...?
What's up, Origami?

Is it okay for your answers to be identical
to mine?

Well, it's homework, so I'm sure it's expected.
I could say I used the textbook.
You have a point. Then I will continue.
Sounds good.
(Looks like I'm avoiding study hall.)
What shall we do after this...?
H-Hm... Rgh.
What's the matter, Shido?

I'm sweating a lot, which is giving me the
shivers. I want to change. Would you mind
getting me some clothes?

Got it. But if you sweat, then you will need
someone to wipe you.
Oh, right. Can you grab me a towel?
No need. I can wipe your sweat.

What? It's fine. Just get me a towel and I
can do the rest myself.
No. You are sick. Be quiet and sit still.
But...

(Origami took out a towel and stood in front
of me.)
Now, sit back and get comfortable.

(W-Well, she's just doing me a favor.
I suppose I could let it happen.)
Shido, you have a nice body.

Origami, if you keep staring, you'll make me
self-conscious. If you're going to wipe me, do
it quickly!
*gulp*...
Shido...

(Origami's touch slightly tickled my body,
and I felt my muscles tighten.)
Shido, I...
(Origami got closer to my sweaty body.)
I... cannot restrain myself.

H-Hey, Origami... You're just wiping my body,
right?
That's right. Whatever will put you at ease.
Mm...

(Suddenly, she pressed her soft lips against my
body.)
Origami, what are you doing? Are you―

(It seemed Origami was licking me, and I felt
something warm and wet tickle my chest.)
Mm, Shido...
Origami, you're not wiping me...
Shido, stay still... Mm...
Origami, stop...!
Mm... *pant*...
It is my duty to clean you.
(She looked at me as if she were in ecstasy.)

(I was at a loss for words. The fatigue from
the sickness made it tough to push her off.)

(I let her do as she pleased, feeling myself
sweat with greater intensity.)
Shido, your body is warmer than usual.
Well, I do have a cold.
Perhaps that deserves more attention.

(It made no sense, but Origami put her
lips against me once more.)

(It was like she was a beast, licking an old wound.
Every lick carried the weight of her undying
affection.)
Mm... Mmmm....

(It was almost endearing, though. Origami's
acts of affection made my heart melt a bit.)

(It was the effort she put in. So precious.
But... I still felt sick more than anything.)
Ah, Shido...
O-Origami...
(Oh, no. I felt ready to faint...)
Sh-Shido, are you okay?
Shido... Shido...

(As I shut my eyes, I heard Origami's voice
fade into the distance.)

(But I was too weak to respond, and I slipped
away into the darkness.)
(By the time I awoke, the sun had set.)

(I sat up, rubbing my aching temples. My
fever seemed to have reduced, at least.)
Shido...
Origami...
(Origami was sitting next to me, concerned.)
Were you here... this whole time?

Shido, forgive me. I should have been more
considerate.

Have you been waiting all day? I'm sorry
for passing out.

Not a problem. I would rather you do that
in order to get well.
Sure, thanks.

No, I feel awful. Even when you were in pain,
I thought only of myself.

I realize now, that I am always imposing
myself upon you.

Can't argue there. Honestly, I'm not used
to how you behave yet, but I wouldn't say
you impose anything on me.
...Really?
Yeah. It's fine. I even like that part of you.

So I want you to be yourself, Origami. I don't
mind if you act spoiled or forceful sometimes.
I accept you for who you are.

Go on, bother me all you want. I like being
surprised, and―

I still want you to like me because... I like
you just as much.
Shido, I am so sorry, and―

Thank you. Thank you for giving someone
like me your time.

However, from now on, I will be more
considerate for your feelings.

Okay, and I will also think more carefully
about what you want.
Shido...
Origami?
I love you.
I love you too.
Nothing can tear us apart.

Of course. Let's see where this takes us.
As soon as I'm better, at least.
Okay.

(Getting sick sucks, but at least it gave Origami
and me a chance to get even closer.)
